name: OpenWork
description: An open-source, local-first desktop application and alternative to Claude Cowork. Built on top of OpenCode, it provides a GUI for non-technical users to run privileged workflows like controlling home automation or deploying apps. Built in 48 hours.
community_quotes: Open-source alternative to Claude Cowork built in 48 hours using Composio tool routing and Claude Code
Native desktop app that brings CLI workflows to a GUI for non-technical users
MIT licensed, hyper-extensible with skills system, fully integrated with Claude Skills
4x faster than Claude's Chrome/Cowork mode according to some reports

name: 1Code
description: An open-source Cursor-like UI for Claude Code that allows running multiple Claude Code agents in parallel. Built by 21st.dev, works on Mac and Web with remote sandboxes. Uses official Claude Code SDK.
community_quotes: Claude Code, but usable - provides a visual interface for running Claude Code agents in parallel
Helps manage multiple Claude Code instances without terminal clutter
Uses official Claude Code SDK, not impersonation like other tools that got banned
Running 3-4 Claude Code agents in parallel dramatically sped up feature development
